meanings.definition: In or to a place not specified or known.
meanings.sent1: She looked everywhere but couldn't find her keys, so they must be somewhere in the house.
meanings.sent2: Let's meet somewhere quiet to have our discussion.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his missing sock was on an adventure to somewhere exotic.
meanings.sent4: Her mind wandered somewhere far away during the boring meeting.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map led them somewhere mysterious and exciting.

meanings.definition: At some point; at some time.
meanings.sent1: I know we will find the answer somewhere in this book.
meanings.sent2: We should go on a vacation somewhere warm next year.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to nap somewhere cozy, like on the clean laundry.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts drifted somewhere peaceful as he watched the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The old clock chimed, signaling that it was time to go somewhere new.
